S.FORM: ipoingaw nyamo. sesane ki singsi ka paigo’o amimitiya na akanakanane na wathakongadavadavanane.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的多納語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say food in thakongadavane.

S.FORM: waigo’o nyaso, biciingi bakaini ki singsi.
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?
老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?
我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: cengela nakay! kisa’apaa nakoa wasyasipi kovasale.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: singsi, maymoo kake wameca na sadrisidrisi.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.
請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: tapata’athay nakay solate, tapacengecengele no saka’isekangenga.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: kake ka valakini ki Gilagilaw. Tanobake kake.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Gilagilaw, and my name is Tanobake.

S.FORM: kake ka siitoini ki Gilagilaw. Tanobake kake.
S.TRANSL: I am a student in Gilagilaw, and my name is Tanobake.

S.FORM: acini ki tatavi nakoa ka Gilagilaw.
kini ka kaka nakoa, acini ka Masegesege.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Masegesege.

S.FORM: acini ka ’Ipolo. kini ka titini nakoa.
kini ka lalili, acini ka Dredrase.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Dredrase。
She’s a friend of mine, and her name is Dredrase.

S.FORM: nakay cicavili ka watamangesalenga sika drosa na cavilini
tatavi mosoa ka watapiyaninga na cavilini nakay cicavili.
nakay cicavili ka watamaimalenga na cavilini ki tatavi nakoa.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: ’iyakay nakoa ’adrosa na kaka, si la’asaseane na gili.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: tatavi mosoa ka manini ko kamolini?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: kaki mosoa ka ’iyakay nyani na kamolini?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: kidro drodrosa cocoaw ka ma’alamengane nyani?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: esi, ma’aagae kiname maesale ka thakada’ane.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: gili mosoa ka waigo’o nyani thoakongadangadavane.
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.
你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: e’e, ’iyaese kiname ki tatava si titina.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.
你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: ’iyaese kiname ki tatava titina si kaka nakoa.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: no kalaapa’ane ta’isasadrane ka sya’abake kake ’abee.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: sesane ka ikakecee, si ikaapa’a masasevee.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: sesane ma’awbo ka amiyaini na va’iyanini?
tabelengane ka kadrowa na koongo ’abwale na taiyaw.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: ’iyasasadrala na da’olo, ’abwale na koli’i, ’abwale na thaybakebake.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: maagi’i nyani na va’iyane mosoa driyane?

S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.
The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: sipiyaliya si lada’olo, ’angoingava wamece na kongokongo.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: wagegegee, sipiyaliya ka no da’olo amiya.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: amiya na makada’olola, dadaane ka malangee’e.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: wada’olo nyani? akwaso ka madapothiso ’angico’olo bwatiso?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: wada’olo balate, iamece kake na kongokongo.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.
The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: matydraw koli’i, wapava’i na aoili patibosoko.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.
I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: Kibaka myaso, mwakita loangay na okodro?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.
那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Kane mikake na gakoini na kidrali.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: sesane ka waamece kake na kyae, viva’ane ka tatakaese kwane!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!
Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: si pasopaa nakoa malra na swape.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: e’e, kikay soswape ko ba’ay mosoa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: Kibaka myaso pasopaa nakoa malra na memane?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: wasosoapela, kake kwakwava Tanobakeane ni pasopai mosoa malra.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask Tanobake to help you.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.
那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.
等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: no siviiso gako ka mani ko paythayaniso?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?
I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: siviini goko kidro ka mani ko paythayanini?

S.TRANSL: May I ask if ’Ipolo is home?
She’s at home, please come in.
May I ask if ’Ipolo is home?
她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?
Grandpa, I’m Dredrase, please open the door.

S.FORM: Moino, kake ka Momoni, ’awkay kake ’abebebee silapemosoa.
S.TRANSL: Moino, I’m Momoni and I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: esi! kyadredreme kaki mosoao ngoalra ibonga ta’avavaane.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: e’e! kikay momadro no cengelimade ka maagi’i sawkoa.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: maagi’i nyani na kwaniso na madro?
titina ka wado’onga na ki’awbo, ngoalra ibonga kwane!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.
盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: ’avagaynga mikake. biilanenga ka ’awkayla mikake cengele mosoa.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.
Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: ipoingaw nyamo, sesane ki singsi ka ameamece amimitiya. Mwa tacekecekelane swapepeale na maodranga.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: esi! tatakaese na maodrange ’apobaka bakaita ka thakongadavane.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說多納語。
Okay! We have to speak thakongadavane to the seniors.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: laka waigo’o komo thoakongadangadavane! Maagi’i sawkoanga!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說多納語啊!真是太棒了!
You guys speak thakongadavane! That’s great!

S.FORM: ipoingaw nyamo, sesane ki singsi ka ameamece amimitiya mwa tabecengane ’akamolo.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: ngoalra kita matiliba, ’angoingava wameca na sa’akamolimo.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: e’e, singsi, waamecenga kiname na sa’akamokamoliname.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: ipoingaw nyamo, sesane ka wamikita tathadethade’ane na sanagolagolay.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: pa’ingcega kita matilibi, pathagilinga mikita loangay na kipe.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: talocobongane ka sana’alralrame, ikodrangane ka sana’asoa’a. tawwa kita cengecengele.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: mwaninga na sesesane na koli’i ka ’awkayya kita ’asawbo.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: wacengele kake ’angiyadraw na soa’a. lacengelela ’angiyadraw na alralrame.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.
Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: tyabao nadroway, takicibane ikay nakay loangolanpoy.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

S.FORM: ma’akava’iyanenga ka amiyaini no mwani gako?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?
He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: takawngo mosoa ka amiyaini no mwani loangay na lacenge?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?
He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: mani ko ’inono yanini na sangepae mwa Takaw?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?
He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
Yes, he took a train to Taitung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: ’iyakay, ’avathiya talocobongane dwavadavace ka no cengele mikoso tiisyaba.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: silikay nakay na ma’adadyalinga ciéing ka ’iyakay dra?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: nakay ka kadrowa na ciéing, kamanimani mekoso ’inono na ciicengce.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: no ’angobasiso ka tithaimini na zikang lakelagako?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: mangesale sika ima na penkang ka kelaami gako.
’inoni made na kawtié ka ’apiyamini na zikang lakela Taicie?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?
I will come to Taichung in an hour.
Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: no’inoniso na ciéing ’awkay da’anili ka ’athaimini na koli’i?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?
Don't, I don't know much about it.

S.FORM: ’amaw myaso no viva’ane? doo myali mosoa ’awkay swapeapeale?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?
Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: ’amaw myaso no si’a? Kokibooboo mosoa toloanini maolayni na thakongadavane.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於多納魯凱語的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I'd like to ask you about the Donalukai legends.

S.FORM: nosi’a ka wamikake egeege, ’ikaiya kake da’ane.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: ko biciiagili ka waigo’o koso mo’ananavanenga ko saakakaini na thakongadavane ko boboboane, pakidredreme kake kokiboboo nyanemya.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對多納的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of Dona and I would like to ask you something.

S.FORM: ikadraw ko igo’ili, makasi taigo’anili ka ’akobii mikake.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: si doo myali luing? namyaninyane no biilanenga ka kapadodoo mikita solate.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.
請問您的太太也是多納人嗎?
Is your wife also a Donner"?"

S.FORM: manini ko igo’i soo na baka?

S.TRANSL: 我會說多納語和萬山語。

S.FORM: maabeabee kake ta’awkaanili mosoa swapeapeale, lava ’apobaka, toloanini no walopimade ko kaysyanini?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: e’e. ko ’athabanili ka ’ataleese kake mwa egeege walopo.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: masitikadringay, saboboiso sesane ka maagi’i sawkoa.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: kikay ’apobakaili ka maesale tyakadringay amani ko sobiilini ko maodrange babaka.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: sesane ka tapata’athayla nakay na bakata. maabeabee kake mosoa sawkoanga na sapakaabeabeiso nakoa.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: ’avagaynga mikake, ta’adra’adraw no biilanenga biciingi ’angiyadradraw na maolay.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: langay mikake na kopo, walangalangay nyamo?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?
No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: mwa pasopaa nakoa longay na baothotho.

S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?
How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: langay mikae na tangaavane ’angidrosa na ébeke.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: nakay ka ’atedranga ’atoo na ébeke, ko ’angico’olo mosoa bwa’ay!
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: kikay thobongo bebe’ase ka piyani na payso?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: sesesane na thobongo ka drosa na iday.
’angico’olo ka maposale sika saseane na payso, ’akamaposala ka mwebate.
nakay ka mavangate sika ima na payso.
ko langayla ’angititiici, paebate sesesane na iday.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: ’angico’olo ka ima na iday sila’amangesale na payso.

S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: kikay pinkange ka matoolo na payso, alrala myaso ’ielane na ma’akakoanga?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: doo myali kisodame mosoa na payso?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: maimoo kake wamece na payso, doo myali kisodame mosoa na payso?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?
I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: maimoo kake wamece na payso, doo myali kisodame mosoa na payso?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ’ayni, paelela ko kisodamiso koa na payso ka isaviviila koso koa.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: kibaka myaso pasodama nakoa na tawngatingi so?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: e’e, makasi nosi’a ka swaviviiya bwa’ay koa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: wada’olo iamece kake na kongokongo, kibaka myaso pasodame nakoa na kongokongo?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.FORM: sesesane nakoa na kongokongo, tatakaese sikongokongo!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: kikay sosolate ka pasodamiso nakoa ko alalaane. ko savivii bwa’ay mosoa.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: ko ’apicengele yaniso na solate ka ’apobaka nakoa.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.
When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: ipoingaw, no ’ikaysonga na payso ka laso savivii koa.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候在還我。
It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: nogiyane no soaviviiso nakoa bwa’ay na payso?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?
I'll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: nogiyane no soaviviiso nakoa bwa’ay na solate?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: ko si’a ka no swaviviilinga mosoa?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: kikay ’ingpice ka pasodamini nyani mosoa ki Tanobake?
S.TRANSL: Did Tanobake lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.
Did you borrow this pen from Tanobake?
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: kadrowa ka timoso, mwa kisodame moinoane ’angititi’ici na timoso.
S.TRANSL: We're out of salt, let's go borrow some from Moino.

S.FORM: mwamaitikaykay Moinoane saviviiya koa na paysoili.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Moino to give me my money back.
How much does she owe you?
I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: madraw na soaw, wasivate la kake, no pwacilacilay mikake.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: kibaka myaso pasopaa nakoa malra nadro sa’alodro si totokono bwa’ay nakoa?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?
我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.
你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: nakay kangdrange doonga mikita malra, kidroway makakawmo ka dooiyala kita malra.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.
(驚嘆語氣)哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
(sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: kibaka myaso pasopaa nakoa paowa kobaw?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?
We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: tangeapane ’adringi ka madrawnga ko drainame kaka’ange.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: no ma’akava’iyanenga ka amiyani no kika’aka’angiso?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: syaakay kake na sabake soabake na ka’ange.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: waigo’o myaso syakay na pana walopo?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: tyadradraw kake syaakay na athiy, malra na bee, kadromane ka syaakay kake na kwange si atho walopo.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: kikay ka sapaiyani dwavadwavace na valisane.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: kikay ka tadredreanini na valisane, nikawni kikay ka tapaiyanini dwavadavace na valisane.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: mwaibongo cengele ko athiita, amiya na mwathii na bee.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: athoatho ka amiya na wasabaynga. taibongo kita mwa.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: kikay sata’ene ka syakay pwalra na tamothoane.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: kinika dreese syakay mikita wathii na thekece.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: maabeabee kita sabalibalini mitiya ki lamama. sesane ka lakadraw na alraita bebee.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: esi! taamece ’abee mwa tacekecekelane. pa’ingcege lwapii bwa’ay talimitiya.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: sesane ka paygo’o amimoane ki singsi na wathakongadangadavane na sanagolagolay.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的多納語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in thakongadavane language today.

S.FORM: sesane ka paygo’o amimoane ki singsi na wathakongadangadavane na sanatiboo.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的多納語怎麼說。

S.FORM: sesane ka paygo’o amimoane ki singsi na wathakongadangadavane na madro.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的多納語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in thakongadavane language today.

S.FORM: kikay sosolate ka nani ko piane?
kikay sadrisidrisi ka nani ko piane?
kidroway kokopingi ka yainyani ki Madi?

S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.
Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.
我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: kake ka titininyane ki ’Isai, kake ka ’Ipolo.
kake ka gilinyane ki ’Isai, acili ka ’Eve.
S.TRANSL: 我是’Isai的妹妹，我的名字是’Eve。
I am ’Isai’s sister. My name is ’Eve.

S.FORM: kini ka singsili, acini ka Masegesege.
kini ka kakinakoa sa’oalay, acini ka ’Alo.

S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?
My elder sister’s name is Momoni.
What is your younger sister’s name?
My younger sister’s name is Moino.

S.FORM: nakay cicavili ka watapyaininga na cavilini ki kaka mosoa sa’oalay?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: nakay cicavili ka watamangesale sika ima na cavilini.
nakay cicavili ka watapyaininga na cavilini ki gili mosoa sa’oalay?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: nakay cicavili ka ta’aima na cavilini.

S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?
你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: esi, ’ikayname gako solasolate ka amiya kiname na thakada’ane.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.
你的媽媽從事什麼工作?
你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: ’aini, kini ka la’osaini ki gili nakoa sa’oalay.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: piyani mosoa na gili sa’oalay si ’abayane?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: kadrowa nakoa na gili sa’oalay, ’iyakay nakoa ’atoo na gili ’abayane.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: piyani mosoa na kaka sa’oalay si ’abayane?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: kadrowa nakoa na kaka sa’oalay si ’abayane.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: esi, kini ka kaka nakoa sa’oalay.
makecee padalemeene, tyadrawa ’ongolo maapa’a na acilay.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.
It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.
The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.
There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: nosi’a ka koli’iya, madraw na koongo, matyadraw besebese.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: dryane ko va’iyane ka kakeceami padalemeene, mobalatiso ka siebela.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: dryanenga ko va’iyane ka da’olo myani?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: dryane ko va’iyane ka no kathao ami, do’oliya.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: dryanenga ko va’iyane ka da’olo myani?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: esi, dryane ko va’iyane ka da’oloami.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.
It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: cyavili no kalakeceane ka kakece myani?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: esi, cyavili kalakeceane ka no kakeceami, sikopingnga ’angyadraw.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: nakay cicavili kalaapa’ane ka maapa’a nyani?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: esi, kalaapa’ane ka maapa’a, tyadrawa ’ongolo na acilay.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: madalame kake na kaladokodoko’ane, mabalesebese ka va’iyane.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很舒服。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: ikadalame kake na kalapapagane, kalapapagane ka madraw na sebee.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?
Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?
你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: siviiso gako ka mani ko paythayaniso?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: siviini gako ka mani ko paythayanini?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: i’ikay ki ’Awni! kake ka ’Ipolo, mani patoloiso? no kelayninga ka no patikaykay mekake ’Awniane.
S.TRANSL: ’Awni不在家耶!我是’Ipolo，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告’Awni。
’Awni is not at home. I am ‘Ipolo. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.
Grandma, we are Moini and ‘Awni, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: kake ka Tanobake, ’awkay kake silape Lawcoane.
S.TRANSL: I am Tanobake, I am here for Lawcoane.
Grandma, I am here to see you.
你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
’Awni, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: moda’ana, wa’adra’adraw kake mosoa ko booane.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: kikay ka doko’ili na bwathi, kwana lwalaa.
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: ngwalra! kikay ka doko’ili na madro, kwana lwalaa.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: ’inonwa, kikay ka doko’ili na i’iposabo’oane ka ngodrangodro, kwana lalaa.
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: idoo kake kane na athiwko, kamani kane na lrin-go.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: ko kathape na madro laso kane.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.
Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: ko alra na acilay pa’ongolo mosoa.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.
Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.
我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: sesane ka ameameceami mwane ki singsi mwa egeege.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: egeege ka ’iyakay madraw na atatinga’olo ami ki titina.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: sesane ka ameameceami mwane ki singsi mwa tawmoma.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: singsi ka ameameceami mitiya mwa drakeale.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: singsi ka ameameceami mitiya mwa egeege.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ’aini, ameameceami mitiya ki singsi mwa egeege.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: singsi, mwata drakeale ka mani ko cengeleyanita?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: singsi, mwata egeege ka mani ko cengeleyanita?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: wamikita tawmoma cengele ko sadoko’ita ngodrangodro, cengela ’iyakay na abongo’o si valo.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.
老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: singsi, waminiata tawmoma doko’o na lacenge?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: sesane ka ta’ocengelela kake na mawdripi na apopangoo.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: wa! madalame kake na acale, maagi’i swakoa.
S.TRANSL: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: kini ka i’aacale, kini ka valo.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: ’ikaya nakay cengele, adriowa na ma’adavili na dida’ane.
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: e’e, waiya kiname na ma’adavili na dida’ane.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.
不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: wa’engtingi kake na sangepae mwa ta’oanane.

S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: Tangooco ka mani ’inonini no mwani kiwkay?
S.TRANSL: How does Tangooco go to church?
Tangooco goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: esi, ’iyanono kake na kaw-tyi mwa Takao.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.
你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: ’angohikoki kake, ’angohikokimade ka maidai kimade na kisya.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: mwaso kiwkay ka ’angobase nyaso? wa’engetingi nyaso na sangepae?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: wa’engtingi kake na sangepae, ’engtingimade na sangepae ka maidai kimade na base.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.
Is the market close to your house?
不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: takanakanane na do’o ka wade’ethe nyani tisyaba?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: mobalatimade tisyaba ka wadavadavace kimade ’aima na penkang lakela.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: ’iyakay ko dwapili sesane i’ikay kake da’ane. saka va’iyanane.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: ’amao nyaso nosi’a? ko ’awkay no viva’ane nga silape mosoa.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: amiyani doomyali lwigi? ko solate sobili.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: ikaagi’i na ta’acoavanili, soko ka isenekete, ’ayni.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.
You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: kokiboboli mosoa ko ’icengecengiso ka mani paythayiso?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: kisace kake ko booane, makasi ’iyasasadranga kake.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: kokibobolimosoa valakiso ka syada’ane nyane ’ikay tacekecekelane?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?
不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: wathade’e kake ’angisea na atho si ’angisea na alralrame, thakada’anili.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: wathade’e kake ’angisea na ngiyaoo, silangelange na thade’imade.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有寵物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: ’api kiboboo kake mosoa na walopimade na kaisyane.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: ikadraw na igo’ili, makasi igo’ili ’akobi ka no ’akobii mekake mosoa.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.
你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?
我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.
那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?
不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: ’Ase, kadrowa da’ane na bava, mwa langay na bava.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.
廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: sesane ka iebate, mwa la lwangay ’angidrosa.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: no langay mikake na bava, ’iyakay nyani?
S.TRANSL: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: no lwangay mekake ’angidrosa, la langay la ’angisea na be’ase.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: be’ase ka ’iyakay nakay, mani langayaniso laa?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: no langay laa mekake na bawthotho, ’iyakay nyani?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: langay mekake na maekekene taymane na kopingi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and blue ones too.
請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.
’Ase你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ’aini, amwa kake pasopaa takawngane lwangay na lacenge.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: aminyani nyane, ’amao nyaso na ma’awbo? wamyata ’angese kwane na do’o?
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯?
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?
No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: ipoingaw nyaso, kokiboolimosoa kikay lelacenge ka piyani na payso?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: sesane na lacenge ka maposale na payso.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: kikay bwathi ka piyani na payso?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: bwathi ka sesane tingatingi ka matoolo na payso,
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: bwa’a koa ’angidosa na lacenge si sesane tingatingi na bwathi.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: ’Ase, maymoo kake wamece na sasolasolate, doo myaso pasodame nakoa?
S.TRANSL: kacaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: kadrowa koa, kikay ka yaini ki Momoni.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Momoni’s.

S.FORM: doo myaso pasodame koa padodaw’o, dodaw’o mekake swavivi mosoa.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.
Thank you and thank Panay for me.

S.FORM: no savivi mekake nakay drodrosa na solate.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?
I would like to borrow these three books.
好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.
You haven’t returned me the eraser.
那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to kacaw?

S.FORM: iigo’o kake, ko wa kiboboo nyane.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Momoni, kikay ebele ka pasodamini nyani mosoa ki ’Ase?
S.TRANSL: panay, did kacaw lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ’aini, kikay ka langaini koa ki titina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.
kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.
他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.
panay, did you borrow money from kacaw?

S.FORM: e’e, ko savivi mekake sesane, la kaymoo ka wamece na payso.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell kacaw for you.

S.FORM: tamothoane ka syakay kimade na ta’ene pwalra tiko’ase ka syakay kimade na athii pwalra, myani nyane ka tyakadringay.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.
原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: si ko paigo’o mosoa, yamimade paithay na sa the’ee si ta’ene.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: e’e! maagi’i sawkoa! nomyani nyane ka biilanenga ka alramikake na bee.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: tawmoma sosoao ka mathangeda’a, mwa soko malra na sa’alodro, tawwa tawmoma.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: ’iyakay ongolo cigi’ane, moda’aniso sooko ka cengele mikoso.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: cengela, macongavanga koso, sa’alodro ka magaange.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.
我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: pwakalava kake pa’ikay nakay, waigo’o kake ta’ikanini athiili.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: kikay omoko ka pa’ikay kiname drakeale poomoko.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: namiya ka kadrowa na omoko, syakay kiname na thanagipane nwagipi.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: isyakay la kake na nagipi, piilanenga ka paigo’o nikoso nakoa?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: e’e! nobiilanenga ka ta’angeese mwa nwaginagipi.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.
I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: ’avelevele nagipiso, mwanagipinga nyani na ka’ange, ibonga bilibili.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: adralala, aavange ka ’avelevele. ko’ikay nakay bilibili, mwaladroway malra na tala’ethe.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: bilibila kaka’ange pawanakay. kopasopaa mosoa bilibili.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: maagi’i sawkoa! madraw aitasesane, sya’etenga omoko.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.
我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: B:nosi’a ka watato na va’iyane, nosi’a noviva’anenga ka tawwa ’aangi na malri!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: B:nosi’a ka niciyobi, no’angese mikake ki titini nakowa mwa kyokai.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.
老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: A:singsi, wa’ange’ange na aoili, na viva’anenga ka nosika mikake.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: A:singsi ’ano sakasokobanenga ka nosika mikake, nowa mikake kicengele na koisanhe.
S.TRANSL: 老師我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.
She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: B:singsi, ki legeageay ka wa’ange’ange na tolo’owanidra, sesane ka nosikaami.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, legeageay has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: akake ka legeageay.thabilane, watamangesale na cavilili.
S.TRANSL: My name is Noami Kulas, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: kake ka valavalakini kowa na lrekay zoko.

S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?
是的，我們全家都是魯凱族。
Yes, my whole family is Rukai.
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ’aini, ki tatavi nakowa ka lrekay zoko, ki titini nakowa ka pakisa.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是魯凱族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Rukai, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: kodro ka tatavi nyani mosowa? watapyaninga na cavilini?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: kidro ka tatavi nyani mosowa? watapyaninga na cavilini?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ’aini, kini ka odranginame tacekecekelane, watamavaolonga na cavilini.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: ki kaka mosowa ka watapyaninga na cavilini?
ki kaka namiya ka watamangesale sika vao na casvilini.
ki kaka mosowa cavilini ka tawmomo nyani mosowa?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?
好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?
I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.
他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: ki ’ongawlo ka ’iyakayni? no tiday amiya pa’akawmawmale.
S.TRANSL: 'ongawlo在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is ’ongawlo? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.
She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: si kowala lwangay na kidrali, adralala si koso silape mosowa.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: mwa silape na cwao, nowa mikake silape singsiyane.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: ki tangoco sesane ka no pa’akawmawmale myani na coycyo?
S.TRANSL: Is tangoco competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: dryane ’ongdokai ka no kisa’apa myaso pa’akawmawmale?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: dryane ’ongdokai ka no kisa’apa myaso pa’akawmawmale?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: no kisa’ap mikake pa’akawmawmale na coycyo.
dryane ’ongdokay ka va’iyane ka manini paythyanita?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: dyane ko no ’ongdokayanita ka manin ko langayanita na kane?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: amalra koso na mwaskasea, tyakadringay maki’ecenge!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: i’ikai, ta’obalatela, no ’ama’awbo amiya laso sivi.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.
他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: esi legeageay aa, ’iyakikaynga nili cengela mosowa. ipoingao nyaso?
S.TRANSL: 是legeageay阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s legeageay. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: magyagi’i kake! ’awkay kake namo pababaka mya.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.
他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.
She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: ki tawmo mwane ka i’ikay da’ane, ’iyakay tawmoma, ’ikaya da’ane ’owadra’adrao.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.
I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: kikai pangodrale ka ba’aili mwane, pawa pingsyange.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: ’iyakikaynga nimiaokai. kowa kwakwao tatakaese kwane na do’o.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: ’ayni adrikaykoco, ko ’ongolo na ’ocya ka mwaebate, ta’ikay ta’avavane mababaka.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: masityakadringay mama namiya twaomana, no’abenga mikake.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: kikai taokoko ka ’iyacocolonga, wameca ’abe lapadalamanee kwane.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: kake si koso nosi’i’a noviva’anenga ka tapacacengeleni?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: no’ikay mikita gako macaceengeli magi’i nyani? nopaytha mikita na ’iga.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.
那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: tacekecekelaniname ko ngapale hahana ka nopwangepangini ka magi’i. no pwangepangininga ka ’awkaya silape nakowa.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: no’adra’adrao mikita nomwaninga na tadangedangane, sawkwa ’aikodrangane.
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?
那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

S.FORM: ko kiboboi mosowa mani ka ’aelayso ’awkay ’ikai tacekecekelane sikace.
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.
Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: nikwani ka kyadredreme kake na tacekecekelanili, samanga lapabii kak tacekecekelane mikake.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: waigo’o nyaso di’ici, nanini ko paigo’o mosowa.
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: amani ki takaongo nakowa, amani kini ko waigoygo’onga d’ici tacekecekelaniname.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: manini ka kokica’owane na wadi’ici myaso.
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: ’ana wadi’ici ka amani ko bengka name, pakidredreme kake nipacongolo bengkaname mya.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: kikai becenge kabavane ka magi’i no’ongolimade.
sawkwa koso maygigili, kikai notibavaimade ka no’ikaykai myamade?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ’ai, nopakapitolo amina va’iyane. amlra kimade ko kapagane si pagai pawgogo, lapo’ibo kimade na aegenge swamo, lapawa kimade cabake loi.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: nakowa nakay ka ’iyakay na tavangolo si tavangane, maesale ’angidadoko’ili!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: drodrosa ko lwangayso ka pyani na payso?
madalame kake nakai kokopingi, pyani na payso?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: doiya, nopolelebili ka no songsolri mikake.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: siminysne! si ko pii na maycenge na kopingi.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: noalra mikake na bakale si palongo.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: ’angico’olo ka 2000 na payso, kikai ka ’angipaythili, tyakalringay nodoo mikoso ’ikikikay syakai.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: ko syokai na la’osyli/lalili nilangai, doo myaso polelebe ’angititi’ici?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: ngwalra cengecengela! walangalangai kiname na kopingi si tawpongo.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: kokiboboi mosowa kikai kokopingi ka piyani na payso.
sesesane na kopingi ka 350 na payso, na too ka 1000 na payso.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: nolangay mikake ’angisesa, si bwa’a nakowa na ba’owane.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: ipoingaw nyaso, ’apilangay kake na kapagane na bowao si makao na botolo.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: bobwao ka maepengenga lwangay. ’iyakayla nakowa na dena na tingpolra, nolangay myaso.
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: e’e! tisesana nakowa bwa’ay, nobilane ka no’awkayla mikake lwangay.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: e’e! ko pasopai mosowa syakay na thobongo pothobongo, na aminaky ka 50 na payso.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
